Function Documentation

FC_ReturnCode fc_addValueToIntArray ( int **  array_p,
int *  num_p,
int  new_value 
)

Add a new value to an array of ints.

Description:

Given an array, the number of elements in the array, and a new value, append the value to the array. The array is assumed to be dynamically generated and the user is responsibly for freeing it when it is no longer in use. The new value is appended to the end and the count is increased by 1. A return value not equal to 0 indicates a failed malloc and the array and the arguments should remain unchanged.

Modifications:

  • FEB-13-2002 W Koegler Created.

01005   if (!array_p || !num_p || *num_p < 0)
01006     return FC_ERROR;
01007 
01008   // copy values & replace array
01009   temp_array = malloc(sizeof(int)*(*num_p + 1));
01010   if (!temp_array) {
01011     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01012     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01013   }
01014   if (*num_p > 0) {
01015     memcpy(temp_array, *array_p, sizeof(int)*(*num_p));
01016     free(*array_p);
01017   }
01018   *array_p = temp_array;
01019 
01020   // add new value
01021   (*array_p)[*num_p] = new_value;
01022   (*num_p)++;
01023 
01024   return FC_SUCCESS;
01025 }

int fc_intCompare ( const void *  n,
const void *  m 
)

Compare two ints.

Description:

Compares two ints and returns 1 if the first is greater, 0 if they are equal, and -1 if the 2nd is greater. Return values are what routines like qsort expect.

Modifications:

  • 10/10/2005 WSD. Promoted (used to be inside fc_sortIntArray()).

Definition at line 945 of file util.c.

Referenced by _fc_buildEdgeConns(), _fc_loadLSDynaDataset(), _fc_readNamesFile(), and fc_sortIntArray().

00950     return 1;
00951   else if (a < b)
00952     return -1;
00953   else
00954     return 0;

char* fc_replaceChars ( char *  in_string,
char  toBeReplaced,
char  replaceWith 
)

Replace occurances of a char in a string.

Description:

Return a new string (to be freed by the caller) where occurences of a specified char are replaced with another specified char.

For example, fc_replaceChar("hi there!", ' ', '_') returns "hi_there!");

Parameters:
in_string  input - input string
toBeReplaced  input - char to be replaced
replaceWith  input - char to be inserted

FC_ReturnCode fc_sortIntArray ( int  num,
int *  array 
)

Sort an int array.

Description:

Just a wrapper around qsort and fc_intCompare.

Modifications:

  • 07/01/04 WSK Created.
Parameters:
